intro: Agrostophyllum kairoanum, commonly known as the Kairoanum grass-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and windy conditions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
